Line 39: Line 39:
The incident led to further protests and calls for the resignation of Chancellor [[Linda P.B. Katehi]]. On November 19, Katehi called for creation of a task force to review the incident and report their findings and recommendations within 90 days.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kcra.com/r/29813746/detail.html|title=Task Force Created To Review Pepper Spray Incident|publisher=KCRA-TV|accessdate=2011-11-19}}</ref>
The incident led to further protests and calls for the resignation of Chancellor [[Linda P.B. Katehi]]. On November 19, Katehi called for creation of a task force to review the incident and report their findings and recommendations within 90 days.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kcra.com/r/29813746/detail.html|title=Task Force Created To Review Pepper Spray Incident|publisher=KCRA-TV|accessdate=2011-11-19}}</ref>

Line 50: Line 50:
===Calls for new Chancellor===
===Calls for new Chancellor===
â
Much of the the response has focused on [http://www.dailykos.com/story/2011/11/20/1038428/-UC-Davis:-Speechless?via=blog_650155 ]
+
<!-- need to add: Chancellors statements from before Nov 19, Nov 19 statements, specific calls for resignation, petition refs-->
  +
Much of the the response has focused on calls for a new Chancellor. Multiple member of the faculty have publicly called for a new chancellor, and signatures are being gathered on petitions for a new chancellor. On November 19, approximately 1000 students and supporters participated in a silent protest against the Chancellor. <ref>[http://www.dailykos.com/story/2011/11/20/1038428/-UC-Davis:-Speechless?via=blog_650155 ]<ref/>
